detaileddescription.para: For details about GNU Radio and using it, please see the main project page.
Other information about the project and discussion about GNU Radio, software radio, and communication theory in general can be found at the GNU Radio blog.

sect1.title: Building GNU Radio
sect1.para: See the page_build page for details about the project's dependencies and build process.

sect1.title: GNU Radio Blocks
sect1.para: GNU Radio uses discrete signal processing blocks that are connected together to perform your signal processing application. This manual contain a list of all GNU Radio C++ Blocks.

Please note that at this time, we haven't found an acceptable way to provide unified documentation for the C++ parts of the system and the parts written in Python (mostly hierarchical blocks). Until this gets worked out, please bear with us, or better yet, solve it for us!

sect1.title: Manual Contents
sect1.para:
More details on packages in GNU Radio:
Audio Interface
Digital Modulation
QT Graphical User Interface
UHD Interface
Voice Coders and Decoders (Vocoders)
Polyphase Filterbanks

sect1.title: Using Volk in GNU Radio
sect1.para: The Instructions for using Volk in GNU Radio page provides an overview of how to incorporate and use Volk in GNU Radio blocks.
Many blocks have already been converted to use Volk in their calls, so they can also serve as examples. See the gr_complex_to_xxx.h file for examples of various blocks that make use of Volk.
